URLs are made up of a series of components, such as their
You can read and write a URL componentâ€™s string value using its respective property.
Although it may be familiar to work with URL components as strings,
it knows more about how a component should be interpreted. These APIs are more convenient, expressive, and
more efficient than operating on string-typed components:
property returns the URLâ€™s hostname as an enum.
This allows request libraries to understand which
and provides a value which can be used to directly establish a network connection.
and can even be used to add and remove path components at arbitrary locations.

accessed via a convenient dynamic property API.
property is a mutable view of a URLâ€™s path components as a standard Swift
, allowing you to easily process a URLâ€™s path using
and other generic algorithms all tuned for maximum performance.
It also includes methods such as
which can be used for complex path manipulation while efficiently modifying the URL in-place.
property is a mutable view of a URLâ€™s query parameters (using HTML form-encoding).
You can read and write the value for a key using the
methods, or use Swiftâ€™s dynamic-member feature to access keys
as though they were properties on the view.
